**Objectives**

This course orients students into various modes of contemporary theory including Western Marxism, psychoanalysis, postmodernism and research areas like biopolitics, and the posthuman. Students will learn to read, analyze, and critique all the required theoretical texts, which address such a variety of topics as modernity, technological reproduction, ideology, culture industry, drive, power, simulation, the (post)human and so on. They also learn to identify their research interests and build up their critical stances and frameworks.

**Requirements and grading policy**

Attendance 10%; discussions, short responses and commentaries (at least 3) 30%; group project and report 20%, term paper (around 10 pages) 40%
